definition[0]: if you say or refuse something point-blank, you do it directly and without trying to explain your reasons
example[0]: He refused point-blank to identify his accomplices.
example[1]: I told him point-blank that I didnâ€™t want to get involved.
definition[1]: a gun fired point-blank is fired very close to the person or thing it is aimed at
example[2]: The victim was shot point-blank in the chest.
